user_stories.title: As a Quantitative Analyst, I want to define a new trading strategy's parameters so that I can capture my trading logic accurately.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on defining the structure and attributes of a trading strategy, including its name, description, entry conditions, exit conditions, risk management rules, and execution parameters. It addresses the core data model for a strategy.
acceptance_criteria: The system allows specification of a unique strategy name.
The system allows a long-text description for the strategy.
The system provides fields for defining entry and exit conditions (e.g., technical indicators, price thresholds).
The system provides fields for specifying risk management rules (e.g., stop-loss, take-profit percentages).
The data model supports various parameter types (e.g., numeric, boolean, string, enum for indicator types).

tasks.title: Design Strategy Data Model
tasks.description: Define the fields, data types, and relationships for the 'Strategy' entity in the database (e.g., name: string, description: text, entry_conditions: JSONB, exit_conditions: JSONB, risk_management: JSONB, created_by: UUID, created_at: timestamp).

tasks.title: Implement Strategy Model in ORM/Code
tasks.description: Translate the designed data model into the application's object-relational mapping (ORM) layer (e.g., SQLAlchemy models, Django models, Mongoose schemas).

tasks.title: Create Database Migration for Strategy Table
tasks.description: Generate and apply the necessary database migration script to create the 'strategies' table and its columns in the chosen database.

tasks.title: Develop Unit Tests for Strategy Model
tasks.description: Write unit tests to verify the integrity and correct behavior of the Strategy model (e.g., field validation, default values, relationships).

user_stories.title: As a Developer, I want to persist new trading strategies to the database so that they are securely stored and retrievable.
user_stories.description: This story covers the backend implementation for saving a newly defined trading strategy object into the database, ensuring data integrity and proper storage.
acceptance_criteria: A new strategy object can be successfully saved to the database.
Attempting to save a strategy with a duplicate name is prevented or appropriately handled.
Database constraints (e.g., NOT NULL, unique) are enforced upon saving.
Successful persistence returns a confirmation or the persisted object's ID.
Errors during persistence (e.g., database connection issues) are handled gracefully.

tasks.title: Implement Strategy Repository/DAO for Create Operation
tasks.description: Develop the data access object (DAO) or repository method responsible for inserting a new strategy record into the database.

tasks.title: Create API Endpoint for Strategy Creation
tasks.description: Design and implement a RESTful API endpoint (e.g., POST /api/strategies) that accepts strategy data and uses the DAO to persist it.

tasks.title: Add Input Validation to Strategy Creation Endpoint
tasks.description: Implement server-side validation for incoming strategy data to ensure it adheres to defined schema and business rules before persistence.

tasks.title: Develop Integration Tests for Persistence
tasks.description: Write integration tests that call the API endpoint and verify that strategies are correctly stored in and retrieved from the database.

user_stories.title: As a Developer, I want to retrieve existing trading strategies from the database so that they can be viewed and utilized.
user_stories.description: This story focuses on implementing the functionality to fetch one or more stored trading strategies from the database, enabling their subsequent use by other parts of the system or external clients.
acceptance_criteria: The system can retrieve a single strategy by its unique identifier (ID).
The system can retrieve a list of all available strategies.
Retrieved strategies include all defined parameters accurately.
If a strategy does not exist for a given ID, an appropriate error or null response is returned.
Performance for retrieving multiple strategies is acceptable.

tasks.title: Implement Strategy Repository/DAO for Read Operations
tasks.description: Develop DAO/repository methods for fetching strategies by ID and fetching all strategies.

tasks.title: Create API Endpoints for Strategy Retrieval
tasks.description: Design and implement RESTful API endpoints (e.g., GET /api/strategies/{id}, GET /api/strategies) to expose strategy retrieval functionality.

tasks.title: Add JSON Transformation for Retrieved Strategies
tasks.description: Ensure that retrieved strategy objects are correctly serialized into JSON format suitable for API consumption.

tasks.title: Write Unit Tests for Retrieval Methods
tasks.description: Develop unit tests for the strategy retrieval methods in the DAO/repository layer.
